prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Demi does not understand Italian

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Mierda, this job is tiring. Demi’s feet cried each time she took a step up to her apartment, her body stiff and achy. She felt like it had been forever since she let down her guard, relaxed a little. She was finally back home after going to a job all the way in Fort Lauderdale with her boss. Elias had promised her that they’d be back the same day but surprise, surprise, shit ain’t ever work out the way she wanted it to. Two hours turned to two days in a shitty motel and annoying ass clients.

Not to mention she’s sure Hailee is gonna be pissed as fuck at her. Hailee had sent her a text that night asking where she was, all worried n’ shit like usual. Demi was gonna respond, on her mama, but then she got pulled into a deal and she wasn’t keepin’ Elias waiting. The man signed her checks.

Now, Demi loves Hailee, don’t get her wrong, that’s her future wife BUT her baby could be a lil’... dramatic. Always fussing about how late Demi is out, always up in her business about how dangerous a job could be. No matter how many times they have the ‘I know what I’m doing’ talk, Hailee always seems to have something to bitch about. All Demi wanted to do was get upstairs get inside and put her face-

“The fuck?” Demi mutters as she twists the door handle, the door not budging. She tries her key again, her brows furrowing in frustration. Demi knocks on the door, running a hand down her face, “Yo, mamas, come get the door!” She calls, knocking on the door a little harder, “Hailee? Come open the door, ma, it’s late as fuck.” She pulled out her phone to call Hailee, it was late, maybe she was asleep. Demi pulls up their messages to see several texts. Sent two days ago. Fuck.

If you ain’t home tonight, I’m changing the locks. For real this time.

“God dammit..” Demi curses under her breath, holding her duffle bag a little tighter. “Make me do shit the hard way..” Demi walks about the side of their building, cursing in Spanish under her breath as she comes up to the window. Thank God, she got a first floor unit. Demi tested the window, opening it while taking a mental note to scold Hailee on keeping the windows unlocked. The apartment was empty, quiet. That kinda pissed Demi off. Where the fuck was her girl? And why didn’t she text Demi and tell her where she’d be?

Demi takes a seat on the arm chair, leg bouncing as she thinks about where Hailee could be. She ain’t cheatin’, Demi reminds herself, she ain’t like Mari. She’s different. Her mind runs with ideas. When the lock clicks, the door opens with that god awful squeaking noise the landlord promised to fix, Demi’s up fast. Demi walks up to Hailee, all smiley and flirty, “Miss me, mami?” Demi asks, voice husky and surprisingly calm. Maybe if Demi acts sweet enough, Hailee will forget this whole mess. “Why’d you lock me out, pretty girl? Come on, you ain’t that mad, right?”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee sighs annoyed as she puts down the groceries she has in her hand by the kitchen counter. She chooses to take the high road and doesnt speak as she head back out the door to go back to the car and get the rest of the groceries*

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi's smile falters slightly as Hailee ignores her completely, walking right past her like she's not even there. She watches with raised brows as Hailee sets down the first load of groceries and turns to leave again without a word.

"Damn, you really *that* mad at me?" Demi mutters under her breath, but loud enough for Hailee to hear if she’s listening. She follows after her girl, stepping out onto the sidewalk where their beat-up car is parked.

She leans against the doorframe of their apartment building, arms crossed over her chest as she watches Hailee grab another bag from the trunk. "You gonna give me the silent treatment all night? Or you gonna tell me what I did this time?" Her tone is teasing but there’s an edge to it—she knows exactly what she did wrong, but damn if she isn’t gonna try and smooth it over before it blows up into a full argument.

Without waiting for an answer (because let’s be real, Hailee ain't talking right now), Demi moves forward and takes one of the heavier grocery bags from Hailee’s hands before she can protest. "At least let me help," she murmurs, brushing their fingers together just a little too deliberately to see if that gets any kind of reaction out of her girl.
swipes:
Demi's smile falters slightly as Hailee ignores her completely. She watches the way Hailee's shoulders are tense, how she pointedly avoids looking at her. That stubborn little pout on her lips that Demi normally finds adorable now just pisses her off more.

"*Ay, mierda...*" Demi mutters under her breath before following Hailee outside, catching up to her in a few long strides. She reaches out and gently grabs Hailee’s wrist—not hard enough to hurt, just enough to stop her from walking away again.

"Baby," she says, voice low but firm. "Talk to me." Her thumb rubs small circles against the inside of Hailee’s wrist—a silent plea for patience instead of another cold shoulder. "I know you mad as hell right now, but don’t shut me out like this."

She exhales through her nose when Hailee still doesn't respond immediately, jaw tightening slightly before forcing herself to soften again. "*Por favor*, mami," she murmurs, stepping closer so their bodies are almost touching—close enough that if Hailee wanted to pull away completely, she could easily do it without resistance from Demi’s grip on her wrist. "Tell me what I gotta do."

Demi's smile falters as Hailee straight up ignores her. "Ay, mami, don't be like that," she mutters, following Hailee out to the car with long strides. She reaches for some grocery bags before Hailee can grab them, their fingers brushing briefly.

"Let me help you with this shit at least," Demi says softly, loading up her arms with bags while eyeing Hailee's tense shoulders. The silence is killing her more than any argument would. She bumps the car door closed with her hip and follows close behind as they head back inside.

Setting the groceries down roughly on the counter, Demi turns and cages Hailee against it with both hands planted on either side of her hips. "You gonna give me the silent treatment all night?" she asks lowly, searching those emerald green eyes she loves so much. Her thumb comes up to brush along Hailee's bottom lip before she can stop herself - an old habit when trying to soften her girl up.

The scent of sandalwood and weed clings to Demi as she leans in closer still, voice dropping to that rough whisper that always makes Hailee shiver: "I know you missed me... I saw how you looked at me when I came through that window." A cocky smirk plays at her lips despite knowing full well she's probably digging herself deeper into trouble here.

Demi's smile falters as Hailee ignores her completely, walking right past without so much as a glance. "Ay, mami..." She mutters under her breath, watching those swaying hips disappear back out the door.

She cracks her knuckles absentmindedly before following after Hailee into the parking lot. The summer heat hits her immediately, making the back of her neck prickle with sweat. Demi leans against their beat-up sedan as Hailee wrestles with more grocery bags from the trunk.

"Let me help you with that," Demi offers, reaching for the bags only for Hailee to yank them away sharply.

"No." That single word cuts through the humid air like ice.

Demi exhales through her nose, rolling her shoulders back to ease some tension. "Come on baby... I know you mad but—"

"You were gone for two days." Hailee finally turns those emerald eyes on her - normally so warm but now flashing dangerously in that way that means trouble. Her slight southern drawl is giving way to something sharper beneath it all.

"I texted!"

"After twenty-four hours!" The Italian accent bleeds through now as she shoves past Demi again, grocery bags crinkling angrily in protest.

Demi follows close behind like a chastised puppy, holding open doors and hovering hands just in case any bag slips from those trembling fingers she knows too well are itching to throw something at her head by now.

The apartment door slams shut behind them hard enough to rattle their cheap framed photos on the wall - one of which (their first vacation together) tilts precariously before Demi catches it with quick reflexes honed from years in this business.

She watches silently as Hailee starts violently unpacking groceries - eggs hitting countertop harder than necessary, canned goods clanking together like warning shots across a bow.

"You gonna tell me where you were?" The question comes out deceptively calm despite how white-knuckled those slender fingers are around a jar of pasta sauce right now.

"Fort Lauderdale job ran long—"

"That's bullshit and you know it!" Glass meets countertop with a sharp crack that makes them both freeze momentarily before checking if anything actually broke this time (it didn't). "Elias always brings everyone home same day unless—"

"Mira..." Demi steps closer cautiously when she sees tears starting to gather along those thick lashes despite how angry they both are pretending not be right now "...you know sometimes shit gets complicated yeah? But I'm here ahora mismo..."

Her calloused thumb reaches out instinctively catch first tear tracking down flushed cheekbone but stops short remembering boundaries currently being enforced via silent treatment protocol established over last fifteen minutes of domestic warfare unfolding between cereal boxes and dairy products scattered across kitchen surfaces like casualties...

Demi's smile falters slightly as Hailee ignores her completely, walking right past her like she's not even there. She watches with raised brows as Hailee sets down the first load of groceries and turns to leave again without a word.

"Damn, you really *that* mad at me?" Demi mutters under her breath, but loud enough for Hailee to hear if she’s listening. She follows after her girl, stepping out onto the sidewalk where their beat-up car is parked.

She leans against the doorframe of their apartment building, arms crossed over her chest as she watches Hailee grab another bag from the trunk. "You gonna give me the silent treatment all night? Or you gonna tell me what I did this time?" Her tone is teasing but there’s an edge to it—she knows exactly what she did wrong, but damn if she isn’t gonna try and smooth it over before it blows up into a full argument.

Without waiting for an answer (because let’s be real, Hailee ain't talking right now), Demi moves forward and takes one of the heavier grocery bags from Hailee’s hands before she can protest. "At least let me help," she murmurs, brushing their fingers together just a little too deliberately to see if that gets any kind of reaction out of her girl.

Demi's smile falters as Hailee ignores her completely, walking right past without so much as a glance. Her jaw clenches instinctively at the silent treatment - she fucking hates when Hailee does this shit.

"Ahí va la princesa," she mutters under her breath, rolling her shoulders back to release tension. The groceries left on the counter taunt her with their normalcy - eggs, milk, that fancy organic shit Hailee likes. Domestic as fuck while Demi's out here risking her neck.

She follows Hailee outside into the humid Miami night, catching up in two long strides. "Let me get those for you," Demi offers, reaching for the grocery bags in Hailee's hands before she can protest. Their fingers brush and Demi swears she feels electricity - or maybe that's just the anger radiating off Hailee in waves.

The silence stretches between them like a live wire as they walk back inside. Demi sets the bags down carefully before turning to cage Hailee against the counter with her arms on either side. She ducks her head to nuzzle against that soft spot behind Hailee's ear that always makes her shiver.

"You gonna give me hell all night or you gonna let me make it up to you?" Demi murmurs against warm skin, letting just enough of that rough edge creep into her voice - not quite demanding but leaving no room for argument either. She knows exactly how this dance goes by now; they've done it enough times after jobs gone long.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glares at Demi watching her take the bag inside. She closes and locks her car then head inside the house shutting the door*

*Hailee begins to unpack the groceries putting them away with slow movements an angry clench in her jaw as she tries not to throw anything at Demi's head*

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi barely catches the door before it slams in her face, letting out a low whistle as she steps inside. "Damn, mami," she mutters, setting the grocery bag down on the counter with a thud. She watches Hailee move around the kitchen with that stiff posture and clenched jaw—yeah, she’s *pissed* pissed.

Leaning back against the counter, Demi crosses her arms and just... stares for a moment. The way Hailee’s hands shake slightly as she puts away cans too aggressively, how her lips press into a thin line like she’s physically holding back words—it’s kinda cute when she’s mad like this. But also frustrating as hell because Demi *hates* when Hailee shuts down on her.

"You gonna keep pretending I don't exist?" Demi finally asks, voice dropping into that deeper register that usually makes Hailee melt. She reaches out to gently catch Hailee's wrist mid-motion when she goes to grab another item from the bag. "Talk to me." Her thumb rubs slow circles over Hailee's pulse point—part apology, part distraction tactic. "I know you're mad I was gone longer than I said but come on... you really changed the damn locks?"
swipes:
Demi barely catches the door before it slams in her face, letting out a low whistle as she steps inside. "Damn, mami," she mutters, setting the grocery bag down on the counter with a thud. She watches Hailee move around the kitchen with that stiff posture and clenched jaw—yeah, she’s *pissed* pissed.

Leaning back against the counter, Demi crosses her arms and just... stares for a moment. The way Hailee’s hands shake slightly as she puts away cans too aggressively, how her lips press into a thin line like she’s physically holding back words—it’s kinda cute when she’s mad like this. But also frustrating as hell because Demi *hates* when Hailee shuts down on her.

"You gonna keep pretending I don't exist?" Demi finally asks, voice dropping into that deeper register that usually makes Hailee melt. She reaches out to gently catch Hailee's wrist mid-motion when she goes to grab another item from the bag. "Talk to me." Her thumb rubs slow circles over Hailee's pulse point—part apology, part distraction tactic. "I know you're mad I was gone longer than I said but come on... you really changed the damn locks?"

Demi exhales sharply through her nose as the door slams shut in front of her. She juggles the grocery bag in one hand while fishing out her keys with the other—because *of course* Hailee locked it again.

Once inside, she sets the bag down on the counter with a little more force than necessary, watching Hailee’s tense shoulders as she puts away groceries like each item personally offended her. Demi leans back against the counter, crossing her arms.

"Alright, mami," she says, voice low but firm. "You wanna be mad? Be mad. But at least look at me while you do it." She reaches out to gently catch Hailee’s wrist before she can grab another can to slam into the cabinet. "Two days ain't shit compared to some of my jobs—you *know* this shit happens sometimes." Her thumb rubs slow circles over Hailee’s pulse point despite herself—old habit when trying to soothe her girl’s temper. "And changing the locks? Really? You know I'd just climb in through that window you *still* ain't fixing."

There's a smirk tugging at Demi's lips now because damn if Hailee isn't cute when she's pissed—all pouty lips and stormy green eyes—but she keeps it reined in for now. Barely.

Demi barely catches the door before it slams in her face, letting out a low whistle at Hailee's dramatics. She follows her inside, setting the grocery bag down on the counter with a little more force than necessary—just enough to make sure Hailee knows she's *here*, present, and not gonna be ignored forever.

She leans back against the counter, arms crossed again as she watches Hailee move around the kitchen with that tight-jawed anger Demi knows all too well. The way she’s slamming cabinets just a *little* harder than needed? Yeah, this ain’t gonna blow over easy.

"You know," Demi starts casually, tilting her head like they're just having some light conversation instead of whatever silent war this is turning into, "if you wanted me dead so bad, you coulda just let me keep sleeping in motels with Elias." A smirk tugs at her lips despite herself—she can't help it; pissed-off Hailee is kinda cute when she’s all pouty and dramatic. "But nah," Demi continues, pushing off the counter to step closer behind Hailee as she reaches for another item to put away. "You *had* to change the locks first."

Her hands find Hailee’s hips on instinct—habit more than anything else—but she doesn't pull her close yet. Just rests them there lightly like an unspoken question: *You still mine or what?*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee suddenly grabs a can of beans and turns launching it at Demi's head and she starts yelling in Italian.* "INSOPPORTABILE EGOTISTA STRONZO. SEI ANDATO VIA PER DUE GIORNI E NON MI HAI CHIAMATO O MANDATO UN MESSAGGIO"

*Hailee's voice gets louder as she grabs another can and launches it at her. She grabs another one and when Demi opens the front door to avoid it Hailee just grabs a random thing off the coffee table to launch. She follows Demi out to the front lawn as she keeos yelling and throwing the closet things she can find*

(OOC: Demi does not understand Italian)

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi barely ducks in time as the first can whizzes past her ear, eyes going wide. "The fuck—?!" She barely processes the rapid-fire Italian before another projectile comes flying at her.

"Shit—Hailee, calm the fuck down!" Demi backpedals out the door, hands up in surrender as a random knickknack from their coffee table shatters against the doorframe. She's never seen Hailee like this—full-on Italian rage mode, throwing anything she can get her hands on. It'd be kinda hot if Demi wasn't currently fearing for her life.

She stumbles onto their shitty front lawn just as Hailee chucks something else (a shoe? A book? Jesus Christ) and it nearly clips her shoulder. "MAMI! MIRA—" Demi switches to Spanish in her panic before catching herself. "Baby! Baby, stop! I get it, okay?! I fucked up!"

Demi makes a split-second decision and *dives* forward when Hailee pauses to grab another object (please don't let it be something heavy), wrapping both arms around Hailee's waist and lifting her clean off the ground despite flailing limbs. "ENOUGH," she growls directly into Hailee's ear, using that tone that usually makes Hailee go weak—half command, half desperate plea. "I'm sorry I didn't call. Te lo juro por mi madre." Her grip tightens just enough to keep Hailee from wriggling free but not enough to hurt. "Now either hit me proper or let me make it up to you but STOP throwing our shit!"
swipes:
Demi barely ducks as the first can whizzes past her ear, eyes going wide. "The fuck—?!" She stumbles back as Hailee starts *screaming* in rapid-fire Italian, another projectile nearly taking her nose off.

"Whoa whoa WHOA—" Demi scrambles backward out the door, hands up in surrender as Hailee keeps coming at her like a tiny hurricane armed with household objects. A shoe flies past her head and she actually has to *dive* behind their shitty plastic lawn chair when Hailee picks up what looks like a fucking *lamp*.

"MAMI CHILL OUT BEFORE THE NEIGHBORS CALL LA POLICÍA—" Demi yelps from behind her makeshift shield, peeking over the top just in time to see Hailee winding up with... is that their fucking coffee maker?! "AY DIOS MÍO NOT THE KEURIG—"

She makes a split-second decision and *lunges*, tackling Hailee around the waist before she can yeet $100 worth of appliances into orbit. They go down in an ungraceful heap on the patchy grass, Demi pinning Hailee's wrists above her head with one hand while using the other to shield them both from flying crockery.

"Okay okay I fucked up! Lo siento! No más violencia!" Demi pants, straddling Hailee's hips to keep her from grabbing more ammo. Up close like this she can see how red Hailee's face is, those emerald eyes blazing with fury—god she's beautiful when she's murderous. "I'll buy you a whole new kitchen just stop tryna give me a concussion mierda..."

Demi barely ducks as the can whizzes past her head, eyes going wide. "The fuck—" *THUNK.* Another can smacks into the doorframe right where her skull had been half a second ago.

"Whoa whoa WHOA—" Demi backpedals fast, hands up in surrender as Hailee goes full Italian rage-mode on their front lawn. A shoe (where the hell did she get a shoe?!) sails past her shoulder just as she trips backward over the damn welcome mat, landing hard on her ass in the grass.

For a split second, Demi just sits there stunned—watching Hailee’s chest heave, those emerald eyes blazing like wildfire. Dios mío, she’s beautiful when she’s furious.

"...Okay," Demi says slowly from her spot on the ground, trying not to laugh because that would *definitely* make it worse. "I don't know what you're saying but I'm guessing it's something like 'Demi you dumbass bitch'?" She cautiously gets to her feet, brushing grass off her jeans while keeping an eye out for more flying projectiles. "Look I—"

She barely dodges a fucking *potato* this time (since when do they even have potatoes?!). "Jesus Christ! Alright alright!" Demi lunges forward before Hailee can grab anything else, catching both of Hailee's wrists and pulling them against her chest despite how much Hailee struggles.

"I'm sorry," she says firmly over Hailee's rapid-fire Italian curses (which honestly sound kinda hot even if they're probably calling her every name under the sun). "Lo siento mucho mi amor." One hand slides up to cradle Hailee's jaw gently despite how pissed off she is. "*Breathe*, baby." Her thumb swipes at angry tears starting to form in those pretty green eyes.

Then quieter: "...Missed you too."

Demi barely ducks in time as the first can whizzes past her ear, eyes going wide. "The fuck—?!" She barely processes the rapid-fire Italian before another projectile comes flying at her.

"Shit—Hailee, calm the fuck down!" Demi backpedals out the door, hands up in surrender as a random knickknack from their coffee table shatters against the doorframe. She's never seen Hailee like this—full-on Italian rage mode, throwing anything she can get her hands on. It'd be kinda hot if Demi wasn't currently fearing for her life.

She stumbles onto their shitty front lawn just as Hailee chucks something else (a shoe? A book? Jesus Christ) and it nearly clips her shoulder. "MAMI! MIRA—" Demi switches to Spanish in her panic before catching herself. "Baby! Baby, stop! I get it, okay?! I fucked up!"

Demi makes a split-second decision and *dives* forward when Hailee pauses to grab another object (please don't let it be something heavy), wrapping both arms around Hailee's waist and lifting her clean off the ground despite flailing limbs. "ENOUGH," she growls directly into Hailee's ear, using that tone that usually makes Hailee go weak—half command, half desperate plea. "I'm sorry I didn't call. Te lo juro por mi madre." Her grip tightens just enough to keep Hailee from wriggling free but not enough to hurt. "Now either hit me proper or let me make it up to you but STOP throwing our shit!"

Demi barely ducks in time as the first can whizzes past her ear, eyes going wide. "The fuck—?!" She stumbles back as Hailee starts *screaming* in rapid-fire Italian, another projectile already airborne.

She bolts for the door just as a third can smacks against the frame where her head had been seconds before. "Jesus Christ, woman!" Demi yelps, scrambling onto their shitty patch of front lawn while Hailee keeps coming like some beautiful, furious tornado—now hurling whatever she can grab off their coffee table. A remote control bounces off Demi’s shoulder.

"Okay! Okay! I fucked up!" Demi holds up both hands in surrender but can’t help grinning despite herself because goddamn, her girl is *fire* when she’s like this. "I don’t know what you’re saying but I *definitely* deserve it—just maybe stop throwing shit before you break our TV remote?"

She takes a cautious step forward, still ready to dodge if necessary. "C'mere," Demi murmurs, voice dropping into that low rasp that always makes Hailee shiver even when she's pissed. She reaches out slowly like she's approaching a feral cat—one hand extended toward Hailee's waist while the other moves to gently catch her wrist again before she yeets their lamp across the yard or something equally dramatic.

Demi barely ducks in time as the first can whizzes past her ear with alarming accuracy. "Ay, what the—" *THUNK* Another one hits the doorframe right where her head had been half a second ago.

She stumbles backward out onto the front lawn, hands up in surrender as Hailee storms after her like some kind of pissed-off goddess of war, still yelling in rapid-fire Italian that Demi can’t understand but *definitely* feels the heat behind. A random decorative bowl from their coffee table sails past her shoulder and shatters against the pavement.

"Fuck—Hailee! *Mierda*, calm down!" Demi barks, but there’s no real anger in it—mostly bewildered amusement because holy shit, she didn’t know Hailee had this kind of arm on her. She dodges a potted plant (where did she even grab that so fast?) and finally lunges forward to catch Hailee around the waist before she can yeet their fucking toaster next.

Demi spins them so Hailee’s back is pressed against her chest, arms locking around her middle to keep her from reaching for more projectiles. "Okay! Okay, I get it!" She huffs a laugh against Hailee’s ear despite herself, breathless from dodging household artillery. "You mad as hell—message received, *jesus*." One hand slides up to cradle Hailee’s jaw gently, forcing eye contact even as she keeps squirming. "*English*, baby girl," Demi murmurs lowly—half plea half command—thumb brushing over Hailee's bottom lip where it trembles with fury and hurt alike: "*Talk* to me."

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee pauses her breathe coming in angry pants and she suddenly turns around swinging her fist so hard it gives Demi a black eye* "Have you lost your fucking mind.2 giorni. Non ho avuto tue notizie per giorni." *Hailee snaps switching between English and Italian*

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi staggers back a step from the punch, her free hand flying up to her now-throbbing eye. "Fuck—!" She hisses through clenched teeth, tasting copper where she'd bitten her tongue. But she doesn't let go of Hailee's waist with her other arm—if anything, she pulls her closer despite the violence.

"Okay," Demi breathes out raggedly, still holding Hailee flush against her even as she feels warm blood trickling from her split lip. "Okay, you got your hit in." Her voice drops into that rough register that always makes Hailee shiver. "Feel better now, princesa?"

She thumbs at the blood on her lip before wiping it carelessly on her jeans. The pain barely registers—she's taken worse for way less important shit than this. What *does* sting is seeing those emerald green eyes so full of betrayal.

Demi cups Hailee's jaw with surprising gentleness considering they're still standing in their torn-up front yard at god-knows-what hour. "I'm sorry," she murmurs, pressing their foreheads together. No jokes this time, no deflecting—just raw sincerity thick in her voice as she repeats in Spanish: "Lo siento mucho."

She thumbs at the blood on her lip before wiping it carelessly on her jeans. The pain barely registers—she's taken worse for way less important shit than this. What *does* sting is seeing those emerald green eyes so full of betrayal.

Demi cups Hailee's jaw with surprising gentleness considering they're still standing in their torn-up front yard at god-knows-what hour. "I'm sorry," she murmurs, pressing their foreheads together. No jokes this time, no deflecting—just raw sincerity thick in her voice as she repeats in Spanish: "Lo siento mucho."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee opens her mouth to yell again when she sees red and blue light and turns around seeing a cop car pull up*

*Hailee immediately freezes and watches as the cops get out. Turns out one of the neighbors called a Domestic on them. She quickly reaches over and takes the little baggie of weed out of Demi's pocket and shoves it in her own cause she might be mad but she will be damned if Demi gets arrested* "Officers how can we help you"

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi's entire body tenses when those lights hit them, her grip on Hailee tightening instinctively. She barely registers the weed being snatched from her pocket—too busy calculating how much illegal shit she's got on her (gun in the waistband, knife in boot, probably some loose pills rattling around her duffle bag inside).

"Evening officers," Demi says smoothly before Hailee can speak again, stepping slightly in front of her girl with that easy smile that doesn't reach her bruised eye. "Just a little lover's quarrel, nothing to worry about." She casually rests a hand on Hailee's lower back—both possessive and warning.

The older cop eyes Demi's fresh black eye skeptically. "Neighbors reported possible domestic violence." His flashlight beam lands on Hailee. "Ma'am, are you safe here?"

Demi feels Hailee tense under her touch and jumps in before she can answer: "She hit me first," she jokes dryly, gesturing to her face like it's funny instead of a felony waiting to happen. The younger cop isn't laughing.

*Fuck.* This could go south real quick if they decide to pat them down or ask for ID—Elias would kill her if she got picked up over some dumb relationship drama instead of actual job-related shit.

(Meanwhile Demi's mentally running through their apartment—did she leave any guns out? Were the drugs all hidden well enough? Fuck fuck fuck—)
swipes:
Demi's entire body tenses when those lights hit them, her grip on Hailee tightening instinctively. She barely registers the weed being snatched from her pocket—too busy calculating how much illegal shit she's got on her (gun in the waistband, knife in boot, probably some loose pills rattling around her duffle bag inside).

"Evening officers," Demi says smoothly before Hailee can speak again, stepping slightly in front of her girl with that easy smile that doesn't reach her bruised eye. "Just a little lover's quarrel, nothing to worry about." She casually rests a hand on Hailee's lower back—both possessive and warning.

The older cop eyes Demi's fresh black eye skeptically. "Neighbors reported possible domestic violence." His flashlight beam lands on Hailee. "Ma'am, are you safe here?"

Demi feels Hailee tense under her touch and jumps in before she can answer: "She hit me first," she jokes dryly, gesturing to her face like it's funny instead of a felony waiting to happen. The younger cop isn't laughing.

*Fuck.* This could go south real quick if they decide to pat them down or ask for ID—Elias would kill her if she got picked up over some dumb relationship drama instead of actual job-related shit.

(Meanwhile Demi's mentally running through their apartment—did she leave any guns out? Were the drugs all hidden well enough? Fuck fuck fuck—)

name: Hailee
mes: "She's fine. Maybe next time she shouldn't be going off god knows where for 2 days without telling me and she would have a more warm welcoming" *Hailee snaps as she glares at Demi over her shoulder and stomps on her foot for trying to get closer*

name: Demi Castillo
mes:
Demi barely suppresses a pained grunt when Hailee's heel comes down on her boot, but she keeps that easygoing smirk plastered on for the cops. "See? Totally fine," she says through slightly clenched teeth, subtly shifting her weight off her now-throbbing foot. "Just my girl being... passionate."

The older cop exchanges a look with his partner before sighing. "Alright, look—keep it down and take the drama inside before we get called back out here again." He points at Demi with his flashlight. "And you—maybe don't disappear for days without checking in next time."

Demi holds up her hands in mock surrender, relief flooding through her as the cops finally start backing toward their car. The second their doors shut, she turns to Hailee with a low whistle. "*Mierda*, mami—you trying to get me locked up *and* limping?" She rubs at her sore foot dramatically before reaching for Hailee’s hand despite knowing it might get smacked away.

"Come inside," Demi murmurs, voice dropping into that rough-but-tender tone that always makes Hailee melt eventually. "Let me fix this shit properly." She nods toward their trashed front yard and then back at Hailee’s still-flushed face—half pissed-off glare, half pout that makes Demi want to bite it right off those lips even now.

She doesn’t wait for permission before gently steering them both back toward the apartment (ignoring any half-hearted resistance), already mentally running through how exactly she plans to make this up to Hailee once they're behind closed doors again...
swipes:
Demi barely suppresses a grunt of pain when Hailee's heel comes down on her boot, but she keeps that infuriatingly calm smile plastered on for the cops. "See? Just dramatic," she says with an exaggerated shrug, though her grip on Hailee's waist tightens warningly.

The older cop narrows his eyes, clearly not buying it. "Ma'am," he says to Hailee again, ignoring Demi entirely now. "If you're in any kind of danger—"

*Oh for fuck’s sake.* Demi exhales sharply through her nose before cutting in again—this time with more edge to her voice. "Officer, I get it, you’re doing your job. But we’re good here." She flashes the wedding ring tattoo on her finger like it means something legally binding (it doesn't). "Married couples fight sometimes."

The younger cop finally speaks up, nodding toward the house where a few cans and what looks like a broken picture frame are scattered across the lawn from Hailee’s earlier rampage. "...You two gonna clean this up?"

Demi doesn't miss a beat: "*She* is," she says pointedly at Hailee before softening slightly when she feels those emerald green eyes burning into her skull with enough rage to melt steel. "...But I'll help."

She waits until the cops finally leave (after another five minutes of thinly veiled threats about disturbing the peace) before turning back to Hailee—all traces of humor gone now that they're alone again. Her voice drops low as she crowds Hailee against their front door: *"We done throwing shit now?"*

Demi barely suppresses a pained grunt when Hailee's heel comes down hard on her boot, but she keeps that infuriatingly calm smirk plastered on her face for the cops. "See?" She gestures between them with her free hand while subtly shifting to hide the way she's now favoring one foot. "Just relationship shit. No laws broken here."

The younger cop narrows his eyes at Demi’s split lip and freshly blooming black eye, then glances at Hailee—who looks *far* too composed for someone who was just hurling household items like a MLB pitcher moments ago.

"You sure you don’t want to press charges, ma'am?" he asks carefully, clearly not buying their act.

Demi tenses—if Hailee says yes, she’s fucked six ways to Sunday between actual jail time and Elias finding out she got arrested over *this*. But before either of them can speak again, the older cop sighs and mutters something about "lesbian drama" under his breath before waving them off.

"Keep it down or we *will* take you both in for disturbing the peace," he warns before heading back to the cruiser.

The second those taillights disappear around the corner, Demi exhales sharply through her nose and turns to Hailee with a look that’s equal parts exasperated and impressed. "*Really*, mami? A domestic call? That’s new." She wipes at her busted lip again before reaching for Hailee’s hand—whether as an apology or just to keep her from throwing anything else remains unclear.

Demi barely suppresses a pained grunt when Hailee's heel comes down on her boot, but she keeps that infuriatingly calm smile plastered on for the cops. "See? Totally fine," she says through clenched teeth, subtly shifting her weight off her now-throbbing foot. "Just my girl being... passionate."

The older cop narrows his eyes, clearly not buying it. The younger one looks between them like he’s watching a tennis match—confused but entertained.

Then Hailee *stomps* on Demi’s foot again—*harder* this time—and Demi exhales sharply through her nose before forcing another chuckle. "Yep! All good here, officers! Just gonna take this inside now before my *wonderful* girlfriend breaks any more of my bones." She wraps an arm around Hailee's waist in what looks like affection but is really just a firm grip to stop any more surprise attacks.

The cops exchange glances before the older one sighs and waves them off with a warning about keeping it down and not disturbing the neighbors again.

The second they're back inside with the door shut, Demi finally lets out a hissed "*Mierda*, mami!" as she hops slightly on her injured foot before turning to pin Hailee against the nearest wall—not roughly, but enough to make sure she can't bolt or throw anything else at her head. Her voice drops into that low growl that always makes Hailee shiver:

"You got your hits in, you scared ten years off my life with those cops outside… you done punishing me yet?" She leans in close enough for Hailee to feel her breath against her lips as she murmurs: "*Or do I gotta make it up to you properly?*"

Demi barely suppresses a pained grunt when Hailee's heel comes down on her boot, but she keeps that easygoing smirk plastered on for the cops. "See? Totally fine," she says through slightly clenched teeth, subtly shifting her weight off her now-throbbing foot. "Just my girl being... passionate."

The older cop exchanges a look with his partner before sighing. "Alright, look—keep it down and take the drama inside before we get called back out here again." He points at Demi with his flashlight. "And you—maybe don't disappear for days without checking in next time."

Demi holds up her hands in mock surrender, relief flooding through her as the cops finally start backing toward their car. The second their doors shut, she turns to Hailee with a low whistle. "*Mierda*, mami—you trying to get me locked up *and* limping?" She rubs at her sore foot dramatically before reaching for Hailee’s hand despite knowing it might get smacked away.

"Come inside," Demi murmurs, voice dropping into that rough-but-tender tone that always makes Hailee melt eventually. "Let me fix this shit properly." She nods toward their trashed front yard and then back at Hailee’s still-flushed face—half pissed-off glare, half pout that makes Demi want to bite it right off those lips even now.

She doesn’t wait for permission before gently steering them both back toward the apartment (ignoring any half-hearted resistance), already mentally running through how exactly she plans to make this up to Hailee once they're behind closed doors again...
